content:
TITLE: Installing WordPress Development Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Command sequence for initial setup of WordPress development environment, including installing dependencies, building assets, and starting the environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install npm run build:dev npm run env:start npm run env:install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running E2E Tests in Interactive UI Mode in Bash DESCRIPTION: Launches the E2E tests in an interactive UI mode for visual debugging and exploration. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/e2e/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run test:e2e -- --ui ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running all phpunit tests in WordPress DESCRIPTION: Command for executing the complete WordPress test suite using phpunit. This will run all test cases found in the tests directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/README.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ phpunit ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running E2E Tests with Default Configuration in Bash DESCRIPTION: Executes the E2E test suite using a headless browser with default environment settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/e2e/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run test:e2e ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running specific phpunit tests in WordPress DESCRIPTION: Command for executing a specific test case file in the WordPress test suite. This targets an individual test file rather than running the complete test suite. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/README.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ phpunit tests/phpunit/tests/test_case.php ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: WordPress Test Suite Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands for running PHP and end-to-end test suites, including examples of passing additional parameters to PHPUnit. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run test:php npm run test:e2e npm run test:php -- --filter npm run test:php -- --group ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running a Single E2E Test File in Bash DESCRIPTION: Executes a specific E2E test file instead of the entire test suite. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/e2e/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run test:e2e tests/e2e/specs/hello.test.js ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Test Coverage Generation Command DESCRIPTION: Command to generate PHP code coverage reports in HTML, PHP, and text formats. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run test:coverage ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Visual Regression Tests in WordPress Core DESCRIPTION: Commands for running visual regression tests locally, which includes generating base snapshots from trunk and then comparing against a feature branch. Test failures produce diff images in the artifacts directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/visual-regression/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run test:visual ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Analyzing Remote Files with getID3() in PHP DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to download a remote file, analyze it with getID3(), and then delete the temporary local copy. It also shows how to pass the original filesize and filename to the analyze() method for more accurate results with partial downloads. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-includes/ID3/readme.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` // Copy remote file locally to scan with getID3() $remotefilename = 'http://www.example.com/filename.mp3'; if ($fp_remote = fopen($remotefilename, 'rb')) { $localtempfilename = tempnam('/tmp', 'getID3'); if ($fp_local = fopen($localtempfilename, 'wb')) { while ($buffer = fread($fp_remote, 32768)) { fwrite($fp_local, $buffer); } fclose($fp_local); $remote_headers = array_change_key_case(get_headers($remotefilename, 1), CASE_LOWER); $remote_filesize = (isset($remote_headers['content-length']) ? (is_array($remote_headers['content-length']) ? $remote_headers['content-length'][count($remote_headers['content-length']) - 1] : $remote_headers['content-length']) : null); // Initialize getID3 engine $getID3 = new getID3; $ThisFileInfo = $getID3->analyze($localtempfilename, $remote_filesize, basename($remotefilename)); // Delete temporary file unlink($localtempfilename); } fclose($fp_remote); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Compose Override for Apple Silicon DESCRIPTION: Configuration override for running older MySQL/MariaDB versions on Apple Silicon processors, specifying the platform architecture. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` services: mysql: platform: linux/amd64 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Genericons Icon in CSS DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to implement a Genericons icon using CSS pseudo-elements. It shows the proper font declaration, content property with the icon's hexadecimal reference, and recommended anti-aliasing properties for crisp rendering. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentysixteen/genericons/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` .my-icon:before { content: '\f101'; font: normal 16px/1 'Genericons'; display: inline-block; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Genericons Icons Using CSS DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to implement a Genericons icon through CSS. It shows the proper syntax for defining an icon using the content property with a specific Unicode character reference, and includes necessary font and display properties for proper rendering across browsers. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentyfifteen/genericons/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` .my-icon:before { content: '\f101'; font: normal 16px/1 'Genericons'; display: inline-block; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating HTML5 Named Character References Lookup Class DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the PHP script that generates an optimized lookup class for HTML5 named character references. The script processes entities.json and updates the core module with optimized entity mappings. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/data/html5-entities/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ~$ php tests/phpunit/data/html5-entities/generate-html5-named-character-references.php OK: Successfully generated optimized lookup class. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building CSS from Sass Files DESCRIPTION: Command to compile SCSS files into CSS after making changes. May need to be run twice to properly update style-rtl.css. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentynineteen/contributing.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Named Entity Mappings DESCRIPTION: Defines a mapping between HTML named entities and their corresponding decimal numeric character references. Each entry includes the entity name, decimal code, and descriptive comment about the character's purpose and Unicode position where applicable. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/data/formatting/entities.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: txt CODE: ``` nbsp | 160 ### no-break space iexcl | 161 ### inverted exclamation mark cent | 162 ### cent sign pound | 163 ### pound sterling sign curren | 164 ### general currency sign yen | 165 ### yen sign brvbar | 166 ### broken (vertical) bar sect | 167 ### section sign uml | 168 ### umlaut (dieresis) copy | 169 ### copyright sign [...additional entries omitted for brevity...] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Genericons Helper Classes Example - CSS Classes DESCRIPTION: CSS rotation helper classes introduced in version 3.4 for rotating and flipping Genericon icons. Classes allow for 90, 180, and 270 degree rotations as well as horizontal and vertical flips. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentysixteen/genericons/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` genericon-rotate-90 genericon-rotate-180 genericon-rotate-270 genericon-flip-horizontal genericon-flip-vertical ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running E2E Tests with Custom Configuration in Bash DESCRIPTION: Executes the E2E test suite with custom environment variables for base URL, username, and password. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/e2e/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` WP_BASE_URL=http://mycustomurl WP_USERNAME=username WP_PASSWORD=password npm run test:e2e ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Modified @font-face Declaration Without Base64 Encoding DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet shows how to modify the Genericons font-face declaration to use direct font file references instead of base64 encoding. This approach provides better performance when cross-domain font loading is not a concern. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentysixteen/genericons/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` @font-face { font-family: 'Genericons'; src: url('Genericons.woff') format('woff'), url('Genericons.ttf') format('truetype'), url('Genericons.svg#genericonsregular') format('svg'); font-weight: normal; font-style: normal; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying WordPress Version Support Matrix in Markdown DESCRIPTION: A markdown table showing supported WordPress versions from 4.1.x through 6.8.x, indicating which versions receive security support. Versions below 4.1.0 are not supported. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/SECURITY.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Version | Supported | |---------| --------- | | 6.8.x | Yes | | 6.7.x | Yes | | 6.6.x | Yes | | 6.5.x | Yes | | 6.4.x | Yes | | 6.3.x | Yes | | 6.2.x | Yes | | 6.1.x | Yes | | 6.0.x | Yes | | 5.9.x | Yes | | 5.8.x | Yes | | 5.7.x | Yes | | 5.6.x | Yes | | 5.5.x | Yes | | 5.4.x | Yes | | 5.3.x | Yes | | 5.2.x | Yes | | 5.1.x | Yes | | 5.0.x | Yes | | 4.9.x | Yes | | 4.8.x | Yes | | 4.7.x | Yes | | 4.6.x | Yes | | 4.5.x | Yes | | 4.4.x | Yes | | 4.3.x | Yes | | 4.2.x | Yes | | 4.1.x | Yes | | < 4.1.0 | No | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Genericons Icon with CSS DESCRIPTION: CSS example showing how to implement a Genericons icon using pseudo-elements with proper styling and anti-aliasing SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentyfourteen/genericons/README.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: CSS CODE: ``` .my-icon:before { content: '\f101'; display: inline-block; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; font: normal 16px/1 'Genericons'; vertical-align: top; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Genericons Font-Face in CSS DESCRIPTION: CSS font-face declaration to load Genericons webfont files in various formats for cross-browser compatibility SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentyfourteen/genericons/README.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: CSS CODE: ``` @font-face { font-family: 'Genericons'; src: url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.eot'); src: url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.eot?#iefix') format('embedded-opentype'), url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.woff') format('woff'), url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.ttf') format('truetype'), url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.svg#genericonsregular') format('svg'); font-weight: normal; font-style: normal; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Genericons Icon in CSS DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet demonstrates how to create an icon using Genericons. It sets the content property to the icon's Unicode value and applies necessary styling for proper display. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentythirteen/genericons/README.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: CSS CODE: ``` .my-icon:before { content: '\f101'; display: inline-block; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; font: normal 16px/1 'Genericons'; vertical-align: top; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Genericons Webfont in CSS DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet defines the @font-face rule for loading the Genericons webfont. It specifies multiple font file formats for cross-browser compatibility. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentythirteen/genericons/README.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: CSS CODE: ``` @font-face { font-family: 'Genericons'; src: url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.eot'); src: url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.eot?#iefix') format('embedded-opentype'), url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.woff') format('woff'), url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.ttf') format('truetype'), url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.svg#genericonsregular') format('svg'); font-weight: normal; font-style: normal; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Genericons Unicode Reference - Font Characters DESCRIPTION: Unicode character reference for Google Plus icon, showing the change from f218 (retired) to f206 (current) in version 3.4. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentysixteen/genericons/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` f206 (current Google Plus glyph) f218 (retired Google Plus alt glyph) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Tree Construction Test Format Example DESCRIPTION: Example showing the structure of an HTML tree construction test, including test data, error reporting, and DOM tree representation. The test demonstrates paragraph nesting behavior and document structure output. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/data/html5lib-tests/tree-construction/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markup CODE: ``` #data

One

Two #errors 3: Missing document type declaration #document | | | |

| "One" |

| "Two" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Test File Structure Example DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic structure of a test file containing multiple tests separated by newlines. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/data/html5lib-tests/tree-construction/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markup CODE: ``` [TEST]LF LF [TEST]LF LF [TEST]LF ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Watching for Sass Changes DESCRIPTION: Command to continuously monitor the theme directory for Sass changes and automatically rebuild CSS when changes are detected. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentynineteen/contributing.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run watch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: WordPress Source Code Access URL DESCRIPTION: Information on how to access the source code for any program binaries or compressed scripts included with WordPress, fulfilling GPL source code availability requirements. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/license.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` https://wordpress.org/download/source/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parsing ID3 Tags from Files in PHP DESCRIPTION: A function that extracts ID3v1 tag information from a file by reading the last 128 bytes and unpacking the data according to the ID3v1 tag structure. It returns an array containing the tag fields including title, artist, album, year, comment, track, and genre ID. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-includes/ID3/readme.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` function getID3($filename) { return unpack('a3TAG/a30title/a30artist/a30album/a4year/a28comment/c1track/c1genreid', substr(file_get_contents($filename), -128)); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Interactive Program GPL Notice Example DESCRIPTION: Example of a short GPL notice that should be displayed when an interactive program starts, with placeholders for commands to show warranty and conditions details. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/license.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` Gnomovision version 69, Copyright (C) year name of author Gnomovision comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'. This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it under certain conditions; type `show c' for details. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Copyright Disclaimer Example for Employers DESCRIPTION: A sample copyright disclaimer template for employers to sign, disclaiming copyright interest in a program written by an employee. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/license.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Yoyodyne, Inc., hereby disclaims all copyright interest in the program `Gnomovision' (which makes passes at compilers) written by James Hacker. , 1 April 1989 Ty Coon, President of Vice ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: LGPL License Notice Template DESCRIPTION: Standard template text for applying the LGPL license to a library, including copyright notice, warranty disclaimer and license terms references. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/js/_enqueues/vendor/tinymce/license.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Copyright (C) This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2.1 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License along with this library; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301 USA ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Copyright Disclaimer Template DESCRIPTION: Sample template for a copyright disclaimer to be signed by an employer or institution, disclaiming copyright interest in the licensed library. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/js/_enqueues/vendor/tinymce/license.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Yoyodyne, Inc., hereby disclaims all copyright interest in the library `Frob' (a library for tweaking knobs) written by James Random Hacker. , 1 April 1990 Ty Coon, President of Vice ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Copyright and License Notice for Source Files DESCRIPTION: A template for adding the appropriate GPL copyright and license notice to the beginning of source files to indicate licensing terms and exclusion of warranty. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentythirteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Copyright (C) This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301 USA. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Interactive Program License Notice Example DESCRIPTION: Example of a short license notice to be displayed when an interactive program starts, informing users about warranty disclaimer and redistribution conditions. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentythirteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Gnomovision version 69, Copyright (C) year name of author Gnomovision comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'. This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it under certain conditions; type `show c' for details. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: GPL License Notice Template for Source Files DESCRIPTION: A template for the copyright and license notice that should be attached to the start of each source file when applying the GPL v2 license to a program. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/license.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Copyright (C) This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301 USA. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Copyright Disclaimer for Employers DESCRIPTION: A sample copyright disclaimer form for employers or schools to disclaim copyright interest in a program written by an employee or student. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentythirteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Yoyodyne, Inc., hereby disclaims all copyright interest in the program `Gnomovision' (which makes passes at compilers) written by James Hacker. , 1 April 1989 Ty Coon, President of Vice ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Copyright Notice for GPL-Licensed Programs DESCRIPTION: A template for adding copyright and license information to the start of source files for programs licensed under the GNU GPL v2. It includes placeholders for program name, copyright year, and author. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentyfourteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Copyright (C) This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301 USA. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Interactive Program Copyright Notice Example DESCRIPTION: An example of a short copyright notice to be displayed when an interactive program starts. It includes the program name, version, copyright information, and brief instructions for viewing warranty and redistribution details. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentyfourteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Gnomovision version 69, Copyright (C) year name of author Gnomovision comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'. This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it under certain conditions; type `show c' for details. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Copyright Disclaimer for Employers DESCRIPTION: A template for a copyright disclaimer that can be used by employers or organizations to disclaim copyright interest in a program written by an employee or member. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentyfourteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Yoyodyne, Inc., hereby disclaims all copyright interest in the program `Gnomovision' (which makes passes at compilers) written by James Hacker. , 1 April 1989 Ty Coon, President of Vice ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Copyright Header for GPL-Licensed Source Files DESCRIPTION: A template for the copyright header that should be added to the start of source files in GPL-licensed programs. It includes placeholders for program name, year, and author information. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentyfifteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Copyright (C) This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301 USA. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Interactive Program GPL Notice Example DESCRIPTION: A sample output notice for interactive programs that displays copyright information and a brief mention of the program's license terms with commands to show warranty and redistribution details. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentyfifteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Gnomovision version 69, Copyright (C) year name of author Gnomovision comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'. This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it under certain conditions; type `show c' for details. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Copyright Disclaimer Sample for Employer/Institution DESCRIPTION: A template for a copyright disclaimer that can be used when an employer or institution needs to disclaim copyright interest in a program created by an employee or student. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentyfifteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Yoyodyne, Inc., hereby disclaims all copyright interest in the program `Gnomovision' (which makes passes at compilers) written by James Hacker. , 1 April 1989 Ty Coon, President of Vice ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample GPL License Header Template for Source Files DESCRIPTION: A template for the license header that should be included at the beginning of each source file in a GPL-licensed program. This includes copyright notice, program description, and terms of redistribution. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentysixteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Copyright (C) This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301 USA. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Interactive Program License Notice DESCRIPTION: A template for the license notice that should be displayed when an interactive program starts. This provides users with basic information about the program's copyright and license terms. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentysixteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Gnomovision version 69, Copyright (C) year name of author Gnomovision comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'. This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it under certain conditions; type `show c' for details. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Copyright Disclaimer Template DESCRIPTION: A template for a copyright disclaimer that can be used by employers or organizations to disclaim copyright interest in a program developed by their employees or members. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentysixteen/genericons/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Yoyodyne, Inc., hereby disclaims all copyright interest in the program `Gnomovision' (which makes passes at compilers) written by James Hacker. , 1 April 1989 Ty Coon, President of Vice ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic GPL License Header Template DESCRIPTION: Standard license header template to be included at the start of source files, containing copyright notice and basic GPL terms. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentynineteen/contributing.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd /my-computer/local-wordpress-install/src/wp-content/themes/twentynineteen ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Node.js Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required Node.js dependencies for the theme's build process. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-content/themes/twentynineteen/contributing.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing libsodium curve25519 structs in Markdown DESCRIPTION: A reference link to the original C implementation of curve25519 structs in the libsodium GitHub repository that this PHP implementation is based on. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/src/wp-includes/sodium_compat/src/Core32/Curve25519/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [structs used in the ref10 curve25519 code](https://github.com/jedisct1/libsodium/blob/master/src/libsodium/include/sodium/private/curve25519_ref10.h) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating WordPress via SVN DESCRIPTION: Command for updating WordPress codebase using Subversion version control. This ensures you have the latest version before running tests. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress-develop/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/README.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ svn up ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Git Repository Reference SHA DESCRIPTION: The specific git commit SHA for the version of html5lib-tests being used in the WordPress project.
